Sentence.sentence: We want to reach parents who are not plugged into the system, said Zaharopol.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Parents are concerned that their children may get involved in criminal offences once they reach their teens.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Exclusivity, more familiar in the world of high fashion, has reached the kitchen: Robinson&Cornish, a British manufacturer of custom-made kitchens, offers a Georgian-style one which would cost £145,000-155,000— excluding building, plumbing and electrical work.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Clearly, richer societies are able to provide environmental improvements which lie well beyond the reach of poorer communities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Parents, teachers, even the kids themselves, scored the youngsters on measures like acting before thinking and persistence in reaching goals.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even the technology  press conferences, which have been high-profile in the past and reached a level of drama and theatrics fitting  for a Las Vegas stage, have a different bent to them.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But US researchers quietly complain about budget restraints and having far fewer icebreakers than Russia, limiting the reach of the United States in Antarctica.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: When a technology is deployed, its impacts reach far beyond itself.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Matt Rubinoff directs I'm First, a nonprofit organization launched last October to reach out to this specific population of students.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Just half a dozen holiday-makers have reached orbit since then, for similarly astronomical price tags.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Private spaceflight could lie within reach of rich civilians in a few years.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It should be difficult enough but still within their reach
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Perfectly eatable fruit and vegetable crops often fail to reach supermarkets due to their size or physical appearance.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Amid the current concerns about the federal deficit, reaching toward the stars seems a dispensable luxury—as if saving one-thousandth of a single year's budget would solve our problems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet due to poor practices in harvesting, storage and transportation, as well as market and consumer wastage, it is estimated that 30-50% of all food produced never reaches a human stomach.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In mature, fully developed countries such as the UK, more-efficient farming practices and better transport, storage and processing facilities ensure that a larger proportion of the food produced reaches markets and consumers

Sentence.sentence: The population increase in cities reached a new peak in Asia and Africa.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In 2005, the Authors Guild of America, together with a group of US publishers, launched a class action suit (集团诉讼) against Google that, after more than two years of negotiation, ended with an announcement last October that Google and the claimants had reached an out-of-court settlement.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It is our responsibility to reach out and attract students to come to our kinds of places," he told a NEWSWEEK reporter.

Sentence.sentence: Even economists can't reach a consensus about its impact

Sentence.sentence: Only the strongest can reach their destination to lay eggs.

Sentence.sentence: Apparently the bus company will be laying off its employees if they can't reach an agreement on wages by midnight.

Sentence.sentence: And by the time she reached her late teens, she had written enough poetry to put together a slender book of verse.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: This exploitation has reached such extremes that presently it appears that some hundreds of thousands of species will be extinguished before the end of the century
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When you reach your top height, do light activities rather than sleep too much.

Sentence.sentence: The lever was beyond the dolphins' reach.

Sentence.sentence: He has already reached the retirement age.

Sentence.sentence: Also, Venice, the city eternally threatened by the sea, where every morning wooden pathways have to be set up to allow tourists to reach their hotels.

Sentence.sentence: But increasingly, as space becomes more democratized, they are coming within reach of ordinary people.

Sentence.sentence: City University of New York CUNY, Rutgers University, and Indiana University were out of reach as were mississippi State and the University of Alabama, where I would have to pay out-of-state fees.

Sentence.sentence: Experts said that whether or not Apple loses this specific case, measures that it could put into place in the future will almost certainly be able to further limit the government's reach.

Sentence.sentence: The market for products designed specifically for older adults could reach $30 billion by next year, and startups want in on the action.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The question is not whether it will reach other rice-growing areas of Europe, but when.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: While human achievements in mathematics continue to reach new levels of complexity, many of us who aren't mathematicians at heartor engineers by trad may struggle to remember the last time we used calculus.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"达到"之意。
means: attain ：侧重指在抱负或雄心的激励下，以最大的努力去达到一般所不及或不敢追求的目的。
reach ：常用词，指到达某一空间、时间、目标或发展过程中的某一点。
achieve ：侧重为达到目的所需的技巧、忍耐和努力。
arrive ：指得出结论，达成某项协议或作出某一决定等。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"到达"之意。
means: come ： 普通用词，含义广泛。强调到达的动作或进程，不侧重是否到达目的地。也可用于比喻意义。
arrive ： 侧重到达目的地或达到某一目标。也可用作比喻。
reach ： 既可指到达目的地，又可指到达途中的中间站。强调经过的周折或付出的努力。

jx.jx_en_mean: outside the distance to which someone can stretch out their hand
jx.jx_cn_mean: 超出某人双手的所及范围

jx.jx_en_mean: inside the distance to which someone can stretch out their hand
jx.jx_cn_mean: 在某人双手的所及范围之内；够得着

entry.def: When someone or something reaches a place, they arrive there.

example.ex: He did not stop until he reached the door...
When the bus reached High Holborn, Tony rang the bell and they jumped off together...
example.tran: 当公交车到达海霍尔本站时，托尼摇响了铃，他们一起跳下了车。

entry.def: If someone or something has reached a certain stage, level, or amount, they are at that stage, level, or amount.
entry.tran: 达到，到达（一定阶段、程度或数量）

example.ex: The process of political change in South Africa has reached the stage where it is irreversible...
example.tran: 南非的政治变革已达到不可逆转的地步。

example.ex: The Belgian player Eduardo Masso has reached the final of the Dutch Open in Hilversum...
example.tran: 比利时选手爱德华多·马索进入了在希尔弗瑟姆举行的荷兰公开赛的决赛。

entry.def: If you reach somewhere, you move your arm and hand to take or touch something.

example.ex: Judy reached into her handbag and handed me a small printed leaflet...
example.tran: 朱蒂把手伸进提包，拿出一张小的印刷传单给我。

example.ex: I reached across the table and squeezed his hand...
example.tran: 我把手伸到桌子的另一边，捏住他的手。

entry.def: If you can reach something, you are able to touch it by stretching out your arm or leg.

example.ex: Can you reach your toes with your fingertips?
example.tran: 你能用手指尖碰到你的脚趾吗？

entry.def: If you try to reach someone, you try to contact them, usually by telephone.

example.ex: Has the doctor told you how to reach him or her in emergencies?...
example.tran: 医生有没有告诉你发生紧急情况时怎样与其取得联系？

example.ex: If I see her, I'll tell her you've been trying to reach her.
example.tran: 如果见到她，我会告诉她你一直在尝试联系她。

entry.def: If something reaches a place, point, or level, it extends as far as that place, point, or level.

example.ex: ...a nightshirt which reached to his knees...
The water level in Lake Taihu has reached record levels...
example.tran: 太湖水位达到了历史最高值。

entry.def: When people reach an agreement or a decision, they succeed in achieving it.
entry.tran: 取得（一致意见）；达成（协议）；作出（决定）

example.ex: A meeting of agriculture ministers in Luxembourg today has so far failed to reach agreement over farm subsidies...
example.tran: 今天参加卢森堡会议的各国农业部长目前尚未就农业补贴问题达成一致意见。

example.ex: They are meeting in Lusaka in an attempt to reach a compromise.
example.tran: 他们在卢萨卡举行会谈试图达成妥协。

entry.def: Someone's or something's reach is the distance or limit to which they can stretch, extend, or travel.
entry.tran: 可达到的距离；所能及的限度

example.ex: Isabelle placed a wine cup on the table within his reach.
example.tran: 伊莎贝尔把酒杯放在桌上他伸手可及的地方。

example.ex: ...a heavyweight who possesses a longer reach and more strength.
example.tran: 出拳更远且更有力量的重量级拳击手

entry.def: If a place or thing is within reach, it is possible to have it or get to it. If it is out of reach, it is not possible to have it or get to it.
entry.tran: （伸手）可及之距离;(可接受的)范围

example.ex: It is located within reach of many important Norman towns, including Bayeux...
example.tran: 它邻近许多重要的诺曼城镇，包括贝叶。

example.ex: The clothes they model for Littlewoods are all within easy reach of every woman...
example.tran: 他们为利特尔伍兹服装店展示的那些服装每个女人都穿得起。

means.word_mean: 1. the limits within which something can be effective;

sentences.sentence: "he was beyond the reach of their fire"

means.word_mean: 2. an area in which something acts or operates or has power or control: "the range of a supersonic jet";

sentences.sentence: "in the political orbit of a world power"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
1. reach a destination, either real or abstract;

sentences.sentence: "We barely made it to the finish line"
"I have to hit the MAC machine before the weekend starts"

means.word_mean: 2. reach a point in time, or a certain state or level;

sentences.sentence: "This car can reach a speed of 140 miles per hour"

means.word_mean: 3. move forward or upward in order to touch; also in a metaphorical sense;
4. be in or establish communication with;

sentences.sentence: "He never contacted his children after he emigrated to Australia"
"Can he reach?" "The chair must not touch the wall"

means.word_mean: 7. reach a goal, e.g., "make the first team";
8. place into the hands or custody of;

sentences.sentence: "Turn the files over to me, please"
"He turned over the prisoner to his lawyers"

means.word_mean: 9. to exert much effort or energy;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rǣcan, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch reiken and German reichen
